ratings.comment: easy class-- no book, but you must go to lecture or else pay 60 dollars to see his slides online. the tests are easy and only require a few hours of studying. easy a, but boring lectures.

Awesome class...I mean there is absolutely no work involved. Show up, get the powerpoints, then read the paper. He is a really funny man with jokes scattered throughout his lectures. I can't remember the joke but on the first day of class he said one about Paris Hilton, it was awesome. Take it if you need 2 of the easiest credits ever.

Extremely easy and straightforward.  There is no textbook or outside homework. He gives you the powerpoints which have all the material.  Study for the 3 exams, and you're fine.  His presentation and his strong accent make class itself pretty boring.  All in all, very easy and good for science credits, but be careful because its only 2 credits.

if you put work into studying the powerpoint slides before the tests, it's an easy A...attendence isn't really necessary, but it helps to reinforce the material...funny guy, boring delivery...this class is all about weather and the like, we only talked about environment and society the last two weeks of class

Easiest class I have ever taken.  Lectures can be boring but you are given the lecture notes in class so that is the only reason to go.  I thought the class would be more interesting but it is a good class to take to finish requirements.  No text book, easy exams, no homework.
I was disappointed with this class.  Overall, the class is easy, but there's no textbook, so you pretty much HAVE to attend lecture.  Plus, the curve screws you over in the end.

I really didn't think it was incredibly easy...although there is no reading from a book, you do have to understand a lot of concepts for the exams.  Be prepared to study for the 3 exams, and you'll do alright.

Pretty easy class overall; 3 exams and thats it. He has a really heavy accent and is hard to understand at times but he's pretty funny, and the exams aren't too bad. Everything is on powerpoints that are posted online, but I suggest coming to lecture once in a while if you want to ace the exams; not everything youre tested on is in the powerpoints

AOS 121 was very easy. All tests were (easy) multiple choice questions- you can find all the answers in the packets he gives you of his power points, (some slides have a lot of writing, others you need to take notes while he talks). no text book! He is even a pretty funny guy!! Go to class (most of the time) and study packets for tests.. that's it!
Professor Wang is hard to understand sometimes, but he is a good guy with a good sense of humor. The review sheets are very helpful for the tests and there is no text to read. Very Easy!

Pao is the****! What a guy...funny little dude with a sense of humor. Don't have to class, thought it is disappointing if you missy some akward joke of his. REcommended for an easy class that you can use as nap time or some extra little credits.

WOW! The EASIEST class I have ever taken in my entire life.  Heck, Pao tells everyone on the first day that he doesn't believe in trick questions on the exams.  And, let me tell you, the exams were VERY easy.  Awesome class  to take.

i would not exactly say this class is the easiest class but you really dont have to go to lectures because you cant understand him anyway. the exams get a little nit picky, not awful though. basically take the class if you dont want to read.

easiest class ever, bar none. granted its a 2credit science, but all information presented is either common sense or learned in elementary science (name the planets anyone?) great class for sleeping in or skipping. powerpoints online, thats if u even feel the need to study

oh my god.  i wish i could take a class like this every semester.  you absolutely DO NOT have to attend class at all, the power point slides are online, and then when test day comes, take about an hour to cram and review all them, and you'll ace the tests.  the EASY EASY tests. god. i love this clas
His class is so easy. tests are on powerpoint packets that are handed out and posted online. NO BOOK. Great class.

I loved Pao!  He has an accent, and was a little hard to understand at first, but once you get used to it, it's not bad at all.  He passes out packets with all of the powerpoint notes on them, and pretty much just tests you on that (be sure to study the diagrams).  His tests were very fair
